intro: Psorospermum kivuense, commonly known as the Kivu psorospermum, is a rare and endemic species native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It is a shrub or small tree belonging to the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white flowers. The plant produces distinctive blue or violet berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from deforestation and habitat loss.
